result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter B Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Peter B Hamilton is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Peter B Hamilton was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. 
Defendant shall submit to random observed testing for the presence of alcohol. 
Defendant shall present himself, sober, to the Platteville Police Department, within the first 30 days of probation, to apologize for this incident.
Defendant shall pay restitution to Clerk of Courts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter B Hamilton

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Peter B Hamilton in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to Ct 1 and state will move to dismiss Ct. 2. State recommends probation for 2 years with the following conditions: pay restitution, counseling deemed appropriate by DOC, maintain absolute sobriety and testing to ensure sobriety, and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1. Court accepts defendants plea and finds him guilty of Ct 1. Court dismisses Ct 2 per agreement. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 2 years probation. Conditions of probation are: to pay restitution, to have such assessment, counseling, treatment, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to maintain absolute sobriety, not to possess or consume any alcohol, submit to random, observed alcohol testing, court costs, and to present self to Platteville PD, sober, within the first 30 days of probation, to apologize for this incident, and DNA. 11 days credit, if revoked.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Status continued.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Peter B Hamilton.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Cases continued for possible global resolution. Status set.
Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall have no contact with Victim 1 and 2. 
Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants.
Defendant shall submit to testing upon request of law enforcement, court, or designee.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt for Peter B Hamilton appeared by phone, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. State heard on bond and requests signature bond with no contact with Victim 1 and Victim 2 and not to consume any alcohol. Attorney Bartelt does not object. Court orders $1000 signature bond and defendant shall not contact Victim 1 and Victim 2, not to possess or consume intoxicants, and to submit to testing upon request. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Court sets status date.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton not in court, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt for Peter B Hamilton appeared in court, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. No appearance by Mr. Hamilton. Mr. Hamilton was told he needed to appear and find transportation by Attorney Bartelt. Court heard on defendant's non appearance and finds that he forfeits his rights to be in person. Tony Vandervelden sworn and testified. Exhibit #1 received and accepted. Cross. Comments heard. Court finds probable cause to bind matter over. Information filed. Court authorizes warrant for his non appearance.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.
DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY CONTACT WITH KH OR TH.

Defendant Peter B Hamilton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Lisa McDougal appeared by phone for defendant, Attorney Lisa A. Riniker appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant qualifies for SPD. State requests signature bond with no contact provision. Court sets bond at $1000 signature with condition: no contact with victims. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
